text.para: A comment in PHP code is a line that is not executed as a part of the program. Its only purpose is to be read by someone who is looking at the code.

list.item: Remind yourself of what you did - Most programmers have experienced coming back to their own work a year or two later and having to re-figure out what they did. Comments can remind you of what you were thinking when you wrote the code

text.para: PHP supports several ways of commenting:

editor.title: Example:
editor.syntax:
<?php
// This is a single-line comment

# This is also a single-line comment
				
/*
This is a multiple-lines comment block
that spans over multiple
lines
*/
				
// You can also use comments to leave out parts of a code line
$x = 5 /* + 15 */ + 5;
echo $x;
?>
